Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2012 08:21AM Sissydi wrote: Good question mom, I'm not sure which kind she had. She was very curious about my treatment plan, and she was trying to convince me my docs didn't know what they were talking about. However, from the good education I have received on the boards here, and further good reading, I knew this was a red flag.
Posts.Title: Cancer like dandelion seeds? Sissydi Moderators

Posts.Content: Sissydi wrote: Okay, I know a gal I used to go to church with that is just finishing up treatment for her breast cancer. I called her up to see how she was doing, and maybe find another breast cancer sister in the area to talk to. She said, her surgeon told her no immediate reconstruction is good because when surgery is preformed on the breast, the cancer is like seeds blown from a dandelion when they are disturbed, and wanted her in chemo right away, so recommended recon after treatment is all over. She was saying my doc should not have recommended immediate recon because of this. Has anyone heard of this? I don't think cancer works this way. And I'm having a hard time thinking about cancer seeds blown throughout my body after mastectomy! What??? Dx 12/23/2011, IDC, 1cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 3, 5/21 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Cancer like dandelion seeds? Sissydi Moderators
